text: Shortly after I uploaded #1000, I decided this would be the theme I'd go with for #2000 and keep the video pure (well, almost!) and simple. This is THE video game theme and there's no need for words, really. As I said in the previous upload, I also feel like that #1000 video was special and I want to keep it that way. I do however want to use this Comments section to thank all of you for the continued support after all these years and give you each a digital thumbs up for helping me create and evolve such a nice VGM community, we did this together. To you who has been following me since the beginning, for a couple years or even just a couple days. It will soon be 10 years since I started this project, which is honestly mindblowing when you think how old we were then. I still remember how obscure the VGM scene was back then and how I thought nobody would really care about my videos, thinking I was one of those "weird nerdy people who like music from video games". I'm sure glad I was wrong and decided to upload that Wild Arms Town theme. I'm also very glad my lazy self decided to go with an unranked list because frankly, that's what kept me going for all these years: uploading whatever track I feel like, whenever I can, without any pressure, with an awesome community.
author: SupraDarky

text:

text: SupraDarky Thank YOU!!! I thought I was weird for loving video game music so much, especially since I hardly play. And I'm a harpist! Thought I'd be alone: finding your channel gave me lots of inspiration. And your uploads often help me figure things out by ear, your videos will be played over and over again as I sit with my harp. Dire, Dire Docks was one of the first pieces I learned to play by ear! So thank you man, I love this channel. ‚ù§Ô∏èÔ∏è

author: Commander Shepard

text:
Just wanted to say thanks for all of the uploads.  I originally found your original first 850 tracks of your list on a torrent, and connected them to this youtube channel. I subscribed thinking that maybe someday you would continue to add more.

I was right.

I really like your list of tracks and look forward to more.  However, my list is incomplete!  While there were a few in this list that had just copyright notices on them and I was able to get them elsewhere.. there are a few #s that are totally null+void, and I never got to write it down to add to my library!

What were the tracks for: 919, 969, 1177, 1499, and 1706?
author: alexpower33

text:
From digging around online, it seems like:
919 was "Eschatos - Point of no Return"
969 may have been "R Racing Evolution - Mars Landing"
1177 may have been "Final Fantasy XIV - Goobbue Mount"
1499 may have been "R : Racing Evolution - Liquid Soul"
1706 may have been "Guilty Gear Xrd - Marionette (Elphelt's Theme)"

author: Philip J. Fry II

text:
Supradarky. Video game music is what got me into making music. Tifa's theme of FFVII is what got me playing the piano. Now I play guitar, piano and sing in my own band and perform self written songs. So to me VGM was always something special. 

I was so happy to find your playlist in 2011. I was delighted not only by the music but also by your comments about the games, especially every 100th game introduction. Every month I was looking forward to listening to a whole set of new songs. And i've listened through all of them. Wrote my favourites on a piece of paper and added them to my own collection. Of which maybe a hundred have a permanent spot on my phone!

 So thank you for all the effort over the years!
